snippet: The digital music locker service drew an infringement lawsuit from EMI in 2007, which led to the bankruptcy filing.
abstract: The digital music locker service drew an infringement lawsuit from EMI in 2007, which led to the bankruptcy filing.

headline.main: Digital Notes: Dogged by Lawsuits, MP3Tunes Files for Bankruptcy

headline.main: Spare Times — For Children for May 11-17

snippet: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. Thursday's selection includes a Mother's Day gift of technology vocabulary, what may happen when Facebook's growth slows and what would happ...
abstract: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. Thursday's selection includes a Mother's Day gift of technology vocabulary, what may happen when Facebook's growth slows and what would happen if Apple entered the Dow Jones industrial average.

headline.main: Today's Scuttlebot: Brain Surgery Tweets, and Fiorina to Zuckerberg

snippet: Some designers repurpose old things for aesthetic satisfaction as well as environmental reasons.
abstract: Some designers repurpose old things for aesthetic satisfaction as well as environmental reasons.

snippet: With lucrative shares and a web of valuable industry contacts, some early Facebook employees have left the company to either create their own start-ups or bankroll their friends, Somini Sengupta reports in Thursday's New York Times.
abstract: With lucrative shares and a web of valuable industry contacts, some early Facebook employees have left the company to either create their own start-ups or bankroll their friends, Somini Sengupta reports in Thursday's New York Times.

headline.main: Daily Report: Facebook Spawns Circle of Young Tycoons

snippet: The Japanese consumer electronics giant expects to return to profit this year, aiming to reduce by half the losses in its television business.
abstract: Sony Corporation posts a record annual loss of 457 billion yen ($5.7 billion) in its fourth straight year of declines as it continues to struggle toward a turnaround.

headline.main: Sony Striving to Cut Its Way From Record Loss to Profit
headline.print_headline: Sony in a 4th Losing Year, The Worst in Its History

snippet: The Mac OS X Dock can automatically hide itself, whether you want it to or not.
abstract: The Mac OS X Dock can automatically hide itself, whether you want it to or not.

headline.main: Q&A: The Case of the Disappearing Dock

snippet: The windfall from Facebook’s public offering may prompt some employees to leave, in what could be one of company’s lasting legacies — a new generation of tech tycoons looking to create or invest in, well, the next Facebook.
abstract: Windfall from Facebook’s public offering may prompt some employees to leave, in what could be one of company’s lasting legacies--a new generation of tech tycoons looking to create or invest in their own companies, or bankroll their friends; while every public offering creates a new circle of tech magnates with money to invest, Facebook's, with a jaw-dropping $100 billion valuation, will create a far richer fraternity.

headline.main: A Circle of Tech: Collect Payout, Do a Start-Up
headline.print_headline: A Circle of Tech: Collect Payout, Do a Start-Up

snippet: Ciudad Juárez is still a violent city, but homicide rates have decreased significantly from their peak in 2010, and young people in particular are stepping out.
abstract: Ciudad Juarez Journal; signs of new life appear in the violent border city of Ciudad Juarez, Mex, as homicide rates decrease and young people in particular are stepping out, hosting fashion shows, joining art collectives and partying after dark at reopened nightclubs.

headline.main: Slivers of Hope Amid the Melancholy in a Mexican Border Town
headline.print_headline: Slivers of Hope Amid the Melancholy in a Mexican Border Town
